name: VideoOptionsHelper
description: The VideoOptionsHelper class provides comprehensive control over Minecraft's video and graphics settings.
overview:
The VideoOptionsHelper class provides comprehensive control over Minecraft's video and graphics settings. This helper allows scripts to read and modify various visual settings including graphics quality, render distance, performance options, visual effects, and display configuration. It's accessed through the OptionsHelper.getVideoOptions() method or directly via the video field.

The VideoOptionsHelper class manages all visual and graphics-related settings:
- Graphics quality - Overall visual fidelity settings
- Render distance - World loading and visibility distance
- Performance settings - FPS limits, VSync, particle quality
- Visual effects - Clouds, entity shadows, view bobbing
- Display settings - GUI scale, fullscreen mode, resolution
- Advanced graphics - Mipmapping, biome blending, gamma/brightness

methods.name: getGraphicsMode
methods.description: Gets the current graphics quality mode. Returns "fast", "fancy", or "fabulous".

methods.name: setGraphicsMode
methods.description: Sets the graphics quality mode.

methods.name: getRenderDistance
methods.description: Gets the current render distance in chunks.
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`Current render distance: ${video.getRenderDistance()} chunks`);

methods.name: setRenderDistance
methods.description: Sets the render distance in chunks.

methods.name: getSimulationDistance
methods.description: Gets the current simulation distance in chunks.
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`Simulation distance: ${video.getSimulationDistance()} chunks`);

methods.name: setSimulationDistance
methods.description: Sets the simulation distance in chunks.

methods.name: getMaxFps
methods.description: Gets the current FPS (frames per second) limit.
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`Current FPS limit: ${video.getMaxFps()}`);

methods.name: setMaxFps
methods.description: Sets the maximum FPS limit.

parameters.name: fps
parameters.description: Maximum FPS limit (0 for unlimited, typical values: 30, 60, 120, 144)

methods.name: isVsyncEnabled
methods.description: Checks if VSync (vertical synchronization) is enabled.
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`VSync is ${video.isVsyncEnabled() ? 'enabled' : 'disabled'}`);

methods.name: enableVsync
methods.description: Enables or disables VSync.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: true to enable VSync, false to disable

methods.name: getParticleMode
methods.description: Gets the current particle quality mode. Returns "minimal", "decreased", or "all".
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`Particle quality: ${video.getParticleMode()}`);

methods.name: setParticleMode
methods.description: Sets the particle quality mode.

methods.name: getGamma
methods.description: Gets the current gamma (brightness) setting.
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`Current brightness: ${video.getGamma().toFixed(2)}`);

methods.name: setGamma
methods.description: Sets the gamma (brightness) level.

parameters.name: gamma
parameters.description: Brightness value (0.0 = very dark, 1.0 = normal, higher = brighter)

methods.name: getCloudsMode
methods.description: Gets the current cloud rendering mode. Returns "off", "fast", or "fancy".
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`Cloud rendering: ${video.getCloudsMode()}`);

methods.name: setCloudsMode
methods.description: Sets the cloud rendering mode.

methods.name: isViewBobbingEnabled
methods.description: Checks if view bobbing (head movement animation) is enabled.
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`View bobbing: ${video.isViewBobbingEnabled() ? 'enabled' : 'disabled'}`);

methods.name: enableViewBobbing
methods.description: Enables or disables view bobbing.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: true to enable view bobbing, false to disable

methods.name: areEntityShadowsEnabled
methods.description: Checks if entity shadows are enabled.
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`Entity shadows: ${video.areEntityShadowsEnabled() ? 'enabled' : 'disabled'}`);

methods.name: enableEntityShadows
methods.description: Enables or disables entity shadows.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: true to enable entity shadows, false to disable

methods.name: getGuiScale
methods.description: Gets the current GUI scale setting (0 = auto, 1-4 = size levels).

methods.name: setGuiScale
methods.description: Sets the GUI scale.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: GUI scale: 0 = auto, 1 = small, 2 = normal, 3 = large, 4 = auto (alternative)

methods.name: getFullscreenResolution
methods.description: Gets the current fullscreen resolution as "widthxheight" string.
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`Fullscreen resolution: ${video.getFullscreenResolution()}`);

methods.name: isFullscreen
methods.description: Checks if the game is in fullscreen mode.
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`Display mode: ${video.isFullscreen() ? 'Fullscreen' : 'Windowed'}`);

methods.name: setFullScreen
methods.description: Sets fullscreen mode.

parameters.name: fullscreen
parameters.description: true to enable fullscreen, false for windowed mode

methods.name: getBiomeBlendRadius
methods.description: Gets the current biome blending radius in chunks.
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`Biome blend radius: ${video.getBiomeBlendRadius()} chunks`);

methods.name: setBiomeBlendRadius
methods.description: Sets the biome blending radius.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Biome blend radius in chunks (0-7, 0 = disabled)

methods.name: getMipMapLevels
methods.description: Gets the current mipmap level setting (0-4).
examples:
const video = JsMacros.getOptions().getVideoOptions();
Chat.log(`Mipmap levels: ${video.getMipMapLevels()}`);

methods.name: setMipMapLevels
methods.description: Sets the mipmap level for texture filtering.

parameters.name: levels
parameters.description: Mipmap level (0 = no mipmapping, 1-4 = increasing quality)
